title: Pseudotsuga menziesii - Douglas fir
description: Pseudotsuga menziesii along the high point (6579') of North to Norway trail at Crosscut Mountain Sports Center, east central Bridger Range, Gallatin County, Montana. Although Pinus contorta (lodgepole pine), Abies lasiocarpa (subalpine fir), and Picea engelmannii (Engelmann spruce) are the three most common conifer species in the Bridger Bowl - Crosscut ski areas, Pseudotsuga menziesii is more abundant on drier sites including upper elevation well drained environments. When the distinctive cones are not present on trees of Pseudotsuga menziesii, the needles of Pseudotsuga that are flat and blunt-tipped are like those of Abies lasiocarpa, but the terminal buds are sharp pointed in Pseudotsuga and rounded in Abies.
label: Original
